data.title: Great breakfast
data.text: Very good  food.  Good  coffee. Good service. You won't leave hungry. On weekends be sure to use the call ahead option. They are very busy. That should tell you all you need to know.

data.title: Great Pancakes
data.text: Have never found a better breakfast restaurant, anywhere! Really good traditional pancake, eggs, bacon and toast, and everything else!! Very scrumptious meals. Very busy at peak times but has a call-ahead plan. Never had a bad or even marginal or even average meal.

data.title: Yum
data.text: Spendy,  but delicious!! My husband and I were excited when we found out it was next to our hotel. Side note,  even if you normally like sourdough,  you probably don't want to get their sourdough pancakes..... Yikes! I guess I've never tasted true sour dough before..... VERY sour and bitter. But their food is delicious and portions are HUGE.

data.title: Good Breakfast But Higher Price
data.text: I have eaten here over the years.  It seems like the prices just keep going up.  I had the 4 Egg Meat Lovers omlett.  It comes with 4 smaller pancakes.  You can upgrade to the larger pancakes for a price which I didn't do.  The meal was good.  The price was $14.50.  Normally, I don't spend this much on a breakfast but I splurged.  The normal type breakfast portions seem small for the price.  Their menue is very large so you can get just about anything you want for breakfast.  If you don't mind spending a little more for breakfast, give it a try.

data.title: Head Turning
data.text: Worth the wait, but you can call ahead and get on a waiting list to minimize your wait. Everything I have ever ordered has been delicious. Hot chocolate to die for! It is hard to take your eyes off of other customers orders as thy go by.

data.title: Ron Rosenzweig
data.text:
Have been going for a long time . Terrific breakfast menu. Even have gluten free pancakes. Affordable and good locations around the neighborhood. Service is great , but some days there are long waits for a table. Food is worth waiting for. 
Ron

data.title: Food is Good
data.text: I think the food here is good, not fantastic. My poached eggs were a bit overdone. The menu is large and you'll find something you'll like. The staff is friendly. I think the prices are moderate, not necessarily low-budget.  The restaurant is busy at peak breakfast times, especially weekends. Be prepared to wait. They do have call ahead seating. I find the restaurant quite noisy during busy times and conversation can be a problem then. If you like pancakes give this place a try. Positives out weigh any negatives.

data.title: My favorite pancakes.
data.text: I go to breakfast every Sunday with my mom and my brother.  We go to Original Pancake House usually for Mothers Day, Fathers Day or birthdays.  It is fabulous.  Sometimes there is a few minutes wait because it is so popular but you can call ahead.  There is never much wait for your food.  It is excellent - and I don't even care for pancakes.  I always have their chocolate chip pancakes, mmmmmmmmm, wonderful.  The rest of the family has waffles, French toast or crepes and they are all fabulous.  The crew is always friendly and very efficient.

data.title: Blah!
data.text: We live in the area and have been here probably 3 times in the last 4 years because the food isn't very good. I think the portion size is huge which may be a draw to some, but I quality over quantity. I've had the crepes (which usually I love elsewhere) a couple times and feel I could have made them better myself. The cherry one tastes like the cherries came straight out of a can of pie filling (no thanks!). I do have to say their bacon is delicious, although really expensive.

data.title: good food but...
data.text: A wide range of choices for breakfast type food, waffles, pancakes, some good looking original recipes. Blueberry waffles and bacon cooked just right. Ok here's the "but" part. $22 for breakfast for one lonely guy? That did include a tip (20%) but still, waffles, bacon glass of milk, cup of coffee? I'm going to look for a coupon before I go back here. A shame, I would've liked to try the potato pancakes...

data.title: Worth the wait
data.text: This location is a family favorite for us. Serene setting with high leather booths. The wait staff has always been top notch for us.  We have our favorites but always wiling to try new things because we're never disappointed. Something for everybody.

data.title: All I can say is YUM!
data.text: This is a must try in our book!  Go there if you can. The food is delicious, so many great choices and specials. We were very impressed with the level of staffing and how well managed they are. I think other restaurant managers should go and take notes!   Warm and friendly, but quick and efficient staff.

data.title: Tremendous service, reasonable pricing
data.text: Gotta make this a family habit. Every Sunday morning, the lines are huge but worth it. Great wait staff, wonderful meals, top notch!

data.title: Swedish Pancakes and More
data.text: We found this pancake house next door to our hotel.  I had the Swedish pancakes.  They were crepe thin and so big they had to fold them over to get them on the plate.  The lingonberry sauce was just like my grandma made.  If you like pancakes you can't go wrong at this restaurant.

data.title: Never Disappoints
data.text: Been going there for some time, but never wrote a review.  I remember when the closest Original Pancake House was in Wayzata so when it also opened up in my hometown of Maple Grove, we were thrilled.  Since then, we've probably been here about 20 times.  This is the best place for breakfast in the Twin Cities and it's not even close.

data.title: Excellent
data.text: I love the food and the prices are reasonable.  OHP is exceptional when it comes to serving large groups!

data.title: My favorite breakfast place. Delicious pancakes and awesome coffee!!!!!
data.text: Even though this is a "chain" restaurant, this is my favorite breakfast place. The coffee is always fresh and hot and the food is spot-on, every time. I highly recommend the "Dutch Boy" and an omelette, and then you can get the buttermilk pancakes. Also, their OPH potatoes are phenomenal.

data.title: love the food
data.text: excellent food but hate the wait and the "call ahead' is joke you still can wait over 90 minutes.  Don't try it on the weekend unless you have time to burn.

data.title: Delicious
data.text: The food was delicious! I had the Banana Caramel French Toast, but all of the meals we ordered were great. The entire staff was friendly. Definitely recommend.

data.title: I love Breakfast
data.text: This is by far the best place to get fantastic breakfast in Maple Grove, MN. Omlets are huge, hash is great and how can you go wrong with bacon pancakes?
